entry.message: [info] Activation of plug-in XBRL rule processor (xule) successful, version Check version using Tools->Xule->Version on the GUI or --xule-version on the command line. - xule
[info] Activation of plug-in SEC Inline Transforms successful, version 19.2. - transforms/SEC
[info] Activation of plug-in Validate EFM successful, version 1.21.1. - validate/EFM
[info] Activation of plug-in Inline XBRL Document Set successful, version 1.1. - inlineXbrlDocumentSet

[DQC.IFRS.0101.9536] The concept ifrs-full:CashRepaymentsOfAdvancesAndLoansFromRelatedParties appears in the investing cashflows of the companies cash flow statement. ifrs-full:CashRepaymentsOfAdvancesAndLoansFromRelatedParties is a financing item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow generated from financing activities. Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item.
Rule Element Id:9536 Rule version: 17.0.2 -

[DQC.IFRS.0105.9556] The following elements are in the presentation linkbase of 01 - Statement of financial position but are not included in any calculation relationship in the filing. ifrs-full:CurrentReceivablesFromContractsWithCustomers, ifrs-full:OtherCurrentReceivables, ifrs-full:CurrentTradeReceivables, ifrs-full:Inventories, ifrs-full:CurrentLoansAndReceivables, ifrs-full:CurrentPrepayments, ifrs-full:CashAndCashEquivalents, ifrs-full:OtherCurrentFinancialAssets, ifrs-full:OtherCurrentNonfinancialAssets All elements appearing in the face of the financial statements should be included in a calculation relationship somewhere in the filing.
This rule will produce an error irrespective of a fact value being entered for the item(s) listed above.
Rule Element Id:9556 Rule version: 17.0.2 -
[info] Activation of plug-in XBRL rule processor (xule) successful, version Check version using Tools->Xule->Version on the GUI or --xule-version on the command line. - xule

Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item.
